dfischer.utils

Class ScreenshotImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.ScreenshotImage

  • public class ScreenshotImage
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds all data about a screenshot. The screenshot image data are usually stored in JPEG format.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScreenshotImage()
      Empty constructor for object transfer.
      ScreenshotImage(byte[] imageData, java.lang.String imageType, int width, int height)
      Standard constructor, stores a new screenshot.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String calcMD5()
      Calculates a MD5 checksum about the object.
      int calcNewHeight(int newWidth)
      Calculates the new height of the image, based on a new width.
      int calcNewWidth(int newHeight)
      Calculates the new width of the image, based on a new height.
      static ScreenshotImage getFromBase64Object(java.lang.String base64ObjectString)
      Constructs a screenshot image from a base64 encoded, serilized object.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the image height.
      byte[] getImageData()
      Returns the image data.
      java.lang.String getImageType()
      Returns the MIME type of the image.
      float getScale()
      Returns a hint about how to render the image by an external utility.

      Returns the specific image data scaled to a new width and height.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenshotImage

        public ScreenshotImage()
        Empty constructor for object transfer.
        See Also:
        writeObject(java.io.DataOutputStream), readObject(java.io.DataInputStream)

      • ScreenshotImage

        public ScreenshotImage(byte[] imageData,
               java.lang.String imageType,
               int width,
               int height)
        Standard constructor, stores a new screenshot.
        Parameters:
        imageData - image data
        imageType - MIME type of image, usually "IMAGE/JPEG", must not be null
        width - image width
        height - image height

    • Method Detail

      • setTextDescription

        public void setTextDescription(java.lang.String textDescription)
        Adds or replaces an optional text-description about the screenshot.
        Parameters:
        textDescription - text-description about the screenshot

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scale)
        Sets a hint about how to render the screenshot by external utilities.
        Parameters:
        scale - image scale, 1.0 = 100%, 0.5 = 50% ...

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Returns the timestamp when the screenshot was created.
        Returns:
        the timestamp in milliseconds, counted from midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC

      • getTextDescription

        public java.lang.String getTextDescription()
        Returns the optional text-description of the screenshot.
        Returns:
        the optional text-description of the screenshot. Note: this method returns never a null value.

      • getImageData

        public byte[] getImageData()
        Returns the image data.
        Returns:
        the image data, usually in JPEG format.

      • getScaledImageData

        public byte[] getScaledImageData(int width,
                        int height)
        Returns the specific image data scaled to a new width and height. Note: calling this method does not affect any internal object data - only the result (image as byte array) of this method has a new size. This method does also not affect the internal scale.
        Parameters:
        width - width of scaled result image
        height - height of scaled result image
        Returns:
        the scaled image data

      • getImageType

        public java.lang.String getImageType()
        Returns the MIME type of the image.
        Returns:
        the MIME type of the image, usually "IMAGE/JPEG"

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the image width.
        Returns:
        the image width

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the image height.
        Returns:
        the image height

      • getScale

        public float getScale()
        Returns a hint about how to render the image by an external utility. A value of 1 means 100%, a value of 0.5 means 50% ...
        Returns:
        a hint about how to render the image by an external utility

      • calcNewWidth

        public int calcNewWidth(int newHeight)
        Calculates the new width of the image, based on a new height. Note: this method does not affect the internal scale.
        Returns:
        the new calculated width of the image

      • calcNewHeight

        public int calcNewHeight(int newWidth)
        Calculates the new height of the image, based on a new width. Note: this method does not affect the internal scale.
        Returns:
        the new calculated height of the image

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.io.DataOutputStream dout)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Serializes the object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readObject

        public void readObject(java.io.DataInputStream din)
                throws java.io.IOException
        De-serializes the object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • calcMD5

        public java.lang.String calcMD5()
        Calculates a MD5 checksum about the object.
        Returns:
        the MD5 checksum of the object, or null if the calculation has failed.

      • getFromBase64Object

        public static ScreenshotImage getFromBase64Object(java.lang.String base64ObjectString)
        Constructs a screenshot image from a base64 encoded, serilized object.
        Parameters:
        base64ObjectString - ScreenshotImage object in base64 format.
        Returns:
        the screenshot image, or null if the object conversion has failed
